label: Societies bear striking similarities. A society governed by a single behavioral norm cannot endure. Consider Sparta, the Hellenic city-state that dedicated its entire social structure to militarization, characterized by stark social stratification rooted in varying degrees of citizenship and slavery. Although Sparta reached unprecedented heights of success, its resistance to change and adaptation led to its downfall. It was ultimately overpowered by the superior strategies of the democratic Theban confederation in the Battle of Leuctra. Thus, the society that embraced flexibility and innovation triumphed over the one that was rigidly fixated on warfare and blinded by its own perceived invincibility.
predict: The societies are very similar. A society dominated by a single behavior is not sustainable. Think of Sparta, the Hellenic city-state that had its entire society geared towards militarization, with a strongly stratified society based on layers of citizenship and slavery. While Sparta was incredibly successful at its peak, it refused to change and adapt, and was eventually broken by the superior tactics of the democratic Theban confederation in the Battle of Leuctra. Thus, the society that allowed for more flexibility and innovation defeated the society that was completely focused on warfare and convinced of its inflexible superiority.
